conflictDescription: User Story A requires starting challenging physical tasks within memory games, while User Story B forbids challenging exercises, allowing only gentle cognitive activities. These impose opposite expectations on the system's behavior under the same condition of cognitive activity selection.
userStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult with mild mobility issues, I want to play memory games that include challenging physical tasks suited to my ability so I can stay motivated and improve my health.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to do only gentle cognitive activities to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured by challenging exercises.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to specify context-aware activity difficulty levels, allowing the system to offer challenging tasks when appropriate and gentle activities when needed, avoiding conflict.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to play memory games with physical tasks adjusted to my ability so I stay motivated and improve health without feeling overwhelmed.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to engage in gentle cognitive activities during memory games when I prefer a low-pressure experience to avoid feeling overwhelmed.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects ALFRED to provide new and more challenging cognitive games to push mental and physical improvement, while User Story B forbids challenging exercises by requesting only gentle cognitive activities to avoid feeling overwhelmed. These are opposing instructions on the type of cognitive activities triggered by user requests.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to ask ALFRED for new and more challenging cognitive games to stay motivated and push myself to improve mentally and physically.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to do only gentle cognitive activities to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured by challenging exercises.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to specify cognitive activity intensity based on user preference or context, allowing ALFRED to offer challenging games when desired and gentle activities otherwise.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to provide challenging cognitive games when I feel motivated to improve mentally and physically.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to offer gentle cognitive activities when I prefer to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to proactively interrupt with challenging exercise prompts, while User Story B forbids challenging exercises by specifying only gentle activities to avoid pressure. These impose opposite expectations about prompting challenging cognitive activities.
userStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to proactively interrupt me with helpful prompts to keep me motivated and challenge myself with harder exercises.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to do only gentle cognitive activities to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured by challenging exercises.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to include context-aware exercise prompting that balances challenge and gentleness based on user preferences and states.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to proactively prompt me with cognitive exercises that are appropriately challenging to keep me motivated without feeling overwhelmed.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to provide gentle cognitive activities or adjust challenge levels to avoid pressure and ensure comfort.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to automatically suggest challenging cognitive games, while User Story B requires ALFRED to allow only gentle cognitive activities to avoid pressure. These impose opposite expectations on the system's behavior for cognitive game suggestion.
userStoryASummary: As a tech-curious older adult with mild mobility issues, I want ALFRED to automatically suggest challenging cognitive games that push me to improve and to continuously track my health to keep me motivated and active.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to do only gentle cognitive activities to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured by challenging exercises.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow ALFRED to suggest cognitive games that adapt to the user's preferred difficulty level, balancing challenge and gentleness based on user comfort and motivation.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to suggest cognitive games tailored to my preferred challenge level to help me improve without feeling pressured.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to recommend gentle cognitive activities when I prefer to avoid challenging exercises to prevent feeling overwhelmed.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to provide challenging, harder exercises to motivate and improve physical health, while User Story B requires ALFRED to provide only gentle cognitive activities to avoid pressure, imposing opposite instructions on the system's operation regarding exercise difficulty.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to provide interactive coaching that challenges me with harder exercises to boost my motivation and improve my physical health.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to do only gentle cognitive activities to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured by challenging exercises.
resolutionDescription: The user stories are updated to specify context-aware exercise difficulty, allowing ALFRED to provide challenging exercises when motivation is high, and gentle cognitive activities when the user prefers low pressure.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to provide interactive coaching with challenging exercises when I am motivated to improve my physical health.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to offer gentle cognitive activities when I prefer to avoid feeling overwhelmed or pressured.
